results.name: wordpress-namespace/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-67df677fb-mvdzl], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the pod mysql-67df677fb-mvdzl is not ready, while 1 ready pod is expected.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs mysql-67df677fb-mvdzl`.
3. Verify readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure dependencies are running.
5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-84fd57ff7b-sjtxp Pod/wordpress-84fd57ff7b-2xhgb Pod/wordpress-84fd57ff7b-v2bw4], expected 3

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected 3 pods are not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Describe a pod with `kubectl describe pod <pod-name>` for issues.
3. Check pod logs using `kubectl logs <pod-name>`.
4. Resolve any errors found.
5. Verify readiness probes.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/wordpress-84fd57ff7b-2xhgb

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.
